message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CV (Computer Vision): The paper primarily focuses on using traffic cameras and vision-based deep learning techniques to accurately detect and locate pedestrians at a signalized intersection. 
2. cs.RO (Robotics): The paper discusses the development of a pedestrian alert safety system (PASS) to improve pedestrian safety at a signalized intersection, which can be considered as a robotics application. 
3. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper discusses the use of a connected vehicle application, the Pedestrian in Signalized Crosswalk Warning (PSCW), to evaluate the vision-based PASS, which involves security and privacy concerns. 
4. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction): The paper discusses the development of a system that generates personal safety messages (PSMs) in real-time to improve pedestrian safety, which involves human-computer interaction. 
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper discusses the development of a system that estimates the location and velocity of a pedestrian more accurately than existing DSRC-enabled pedestrian hand-held devices, which involves systems and control.
